- [ ] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I want to register a Gitlab runner using Windows Shell .I'm unable to type after "Enter the GitLab instance URL (for example, https://gitlab.com/):"

### Expected behavior

```console
I should be able to type after "Enter the GitLab instance URL (for example, https://gitlab.com/):"
```


### Actual behavior

```console
I'm unable to type after "Enter the GitLab instance URL (for example, https://gitlab.com/):"
```

comments.body: Does invoking gitlab cause another modal dialog box to pop up? I have seen cases where dialog boxes get spawned and are not always visible - is a task bar icon flashing?

comments.author: Purav2596
comments.body:
I faced the same issue. It seems that we must first install the Runner. Try the following in Powershell in the directory where the gitlab-runner is located- 

.\gitlab-runner.exe install
.\gitlab-runner.exe start
.\gitlab-runner.exe stop

Now try to register the runner. Probably, you should be able to enter the URL now.
